summary:
**Meeting Overview**: The Dallas Environmental Commission will hold a regular meeting on January 10, 2024, at 5:30 p.m. at City Hall, with options for videoconference participation. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss environmental initiatives, review past activities, and make decisions on key proposals.

**Key Agenda Items**:
1. Approval of minutes from the December 13, 2023 meeting.
2. Briefings on the Environmental Due Diligence (EDD) and Municipal Setting Designation (MSD) programs, as well as updated considerations for the Comprehensive Environmental & Climate Action Plan (CECAP) in relation to the 2024 Bond Program.
3. Voting on the approval of the Environmental Commission FY23 Annual Report.

**Important Details**:
- The EDD and MSD programs will be reviewed, highlighting their roles in managing environmental risks associated with city property acquisitions and redevelopment.
- The updated CECAP considerations will focus on integrating sustainability into the 2024 Bond Program, emphasizing performance criteria for new projects.
- The meeting will also include discussions on subcommittee appointments and updates on ongoing projects related to environmental health and justice.

**Action Items**:
- Approval of the FY23 Annual Report.
- Discussion and potential appointment of members to various subcommittees.
- Consideration of recommendations regarding the integration of CECAP goals into the Bond Program.

This meeting aims to enhance community engagement in environmental issues and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
